properties.name: Cognac
properties.description: Posted by NivaghLived here while working for Hennessy Cognac for four months in the Summer of 1998. Nice town with a lovely climate and internationally renowned for its famous drink. I was here when France won the world cup against Brazil. Now that was a party!

properties.name: College of Corpus Christi and the Blessed Virgin Mary
properties.description: Posted by NivaghMy alma mater! I went up to Cambridge in 1996 to read Modern and Medieval Languages (MML) - a tough four years but hugely rewarding.

properties.description: Posted by Nivagh

properties.name: Ghost Town at Kaya Koyu
properties.description: Posted by NivaghThis entire town of some 200+ buildings has lain abandoned since 1923 when the Turks expelled the Greek inhabitants. An eerily quiet place, and strangely moving. Also close by you will find some lycean rock tombs, though not particularly elaborate.

properties.name: Ghost town of Kaya Koyu
properties.description: Posted by NivaghThis town of over 200 stone houses and several churches has been left to crumble and decay since Turkey expelled the Greek occupants in 1923. A spooky, uneasy place.

properties.name: I was born here! 01/02/1978
properties.description: Posted by NivaghCity General Hospital, Carlisle. Now St. Martin\'s College. History of City General Hospital Carlisle

properties.name: Pyramiden - abandoned Russian mining town
properties.description: Posted by NivaghSvalbard is an archipelago about 40 degrees North, lying in the Arctic seas north of Norway. Various countries, including the former USSR, signed the treaty of Svalbard which established Norwegian sovereignty but afforded mineral mining rights to the signatories. The USSR established a colony called Pyramiden, named after the pyrimidal peak behind the town, from which they mined coal. The town was abandoned in 1998 and has been gradually dismantled of salvageable kit in the Summers since. There is talk of the resumption of mining in 2007.

properties.name: Scafell Pike - England's highest mountain
properties.description: Posted by NivaghStanding at 987 metres above sea level, Scafell Pike is England\'s higest peak. Situated near the West coast of Cumbria

properties.name: Scafell Pike - England's highest point
properties.description: Posted by NivaghScafell Pike is the highest peak in England at 978 metres above sea level. (I would tell you what it is in feet but hey - it\'s the 21st century and Europe went metric years ago...!!) Situated near the West coast of Cumbria, it\'s possible to walk from sea level to the highest point in the country, and back, in a single day, if so minded. Ordnance Survey Map
